H0.text: What type of 'helpful' businesses operate on the basis of the Rochdale Principles that were formulated in 1844. Mutual Aid Society

H1.text: What type of 'helpful' businesses operate on the basis of the Rochdale Principles that were formulated in 1844. Community Land Trust

H2.text: What type of 'helpful' businesses operate on the basis of the Rochdale Principles that were formulated in 1844. Credit Union

H3.text: What type of 'helpful' businesses operate on the basis of the Rochdale Principles that were formulated in 1844. Co-Op

A4.text: The Rochdale Society of Equitable Pioneers, founded in 1844, is usually considered the first successful cooperative enterprise, used as a model for modern coops, following the 'Rochdale Principles'.

A5.text: In 2014, ICA introduced the Global Cooperative Marque for use by ICAs Cooperative members and by WOCCU's Credit Union members so they can be further identified by their coop ethical consumerism label.

A6.text: Credit unions differ from banks and other financial institutions in that those who have accounts in the credit union are its members and owners, and they elect their board of directors in a one-person-one-vote system, regardless of the amount they might have invested.

A7.text: Credit unions are 'not-for-profit' because their purpose is to serve their members rather than to maximize profits.
